intro: Pilosella cymantha, commonly known as the clustered Goatsbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of silver-gray, hairy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a cluster. Pilosella cymantha is often found in meadows and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for garden cultivation in temperate regions.
